newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta call money eases on ample supply.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta call money eases on ample supply.

text.p: Jakarta call money eased to nine percent from 12.0/15.0 percent on Friday on the back of ample liquidity despite a neutral money policy, dealers said.

They said operators were cautious at the opening about possible tightness because of the neutral money policy, but government transfers of civil servant salaries made the market flush, driving interbank rates lower.
One-month money was at 13.25/13.50 percent and three-month at 13.75/14.25 percent.
The central bank offered three-day bilateral papers (SBIs) at six percent, one-week at 6.5, two-week at 8.5 percent, one-month at 10.25 percent and three-month at 11.25 percent.
The average overnight interbank rate on Wednesday was 6.49 percent, compared with 7.61 percent on Tuesday.
Bond dealers said prices were unchanged in thin volume.
